data.title: Read Exclusive Offshore Renewable News Here Today
data.text:
General Windfarms

Codling Wind Park will have a generating capacity of 1,300 MW – generating enough clean energy to power over one million Irish homes.

Codling Wind Park, Ireland’s largest offshore renewable energy project, submits planning application

General Windfarms

Energy company Vattenfall and steel producer Salzgitter are pushing ahead with their joint goal of decarbonising industrial production processes.

Vattenfall and Salzgitter enter into offshore wind green steel electricity partnership

Floating General Windfarms

The Ministry of Environment of the Republic of Korea has awarded the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) for Ocean Winds and Mainstream Renewable Power entire 1,125 MW floating offshore wind project off the coast of Ulsan, South Korea

Ocean Winds and Mainstream Renewable Power awarded EIA for KF Wind project in South Korea

Cables General Turbines Vessels Windfarms

Offshore wind energy is rapidly gaining traction in the U.S., with the potential to revolutionise the nation’s energy landscape. The Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy recently highlighted some lesser-known facts about this burgeoning industry.

U.S. offshore wind energy: 10 fascinating facts you didn’t know

Cables General Interconnectors

AQUIND has strongly refuted recent objections raised by the Ministry of Defence (MoD) regarding the AQUIND Interconnector project, a critical energy infrastructure initiative intended to enhance the UK's energy security.

AQUIND responds to UK Ministry of Defence's concerns over interconnector project

Cables General Interconnectors Turbines Windfarms

The Ministry of Defence (MOD) has expressed significant UK national security concerns regarding the proposed Aquind electricity interconnector project, which seeks development consent for an infrastructure link between the UK and France.

MOD raises UK national security concerns over Aquind Interconnector Project

General Windfarms

Baltic Wind released a statement today declaring that Sweden's renewable energy leaders have issued a call for the government to expand its focus beyond nuclear power to include all fossil-free energy sources.

Swedish renewable energy sector urges Government for broader support to meet 2035 goals

CHMI General Turbines Vessels Windfarms

EnBW has successfully completed the installation of all 64 foundations for He Dreiht, Germany’s largest offshore wind farm currently under construction.

Germany’s largest offshore wind farm reaches major construction milestone

General Windfarms

"K" Line Wind Service Ltd (KWS), a subsidiary of the "K" LINE Group, has entered into a collaborative agreement with Acteon Group Operations Limited to support Japan's emerging floating offshore wind sector.

"K" Line Wind Service and Acteon partner for Japan's floating offshore wind projects

General Turbines Windfarms

Hexicon AB, a leading developer of floating offshore wind farms, has announced a major milestone for its MunmuBaram project off the coast of Ulsan, South Korea.

Hexicon's South Korea offshore wind project clears key environmental hurdle

Corporate General Substations Turbines Windfarms

On August 20th, a tragic incident occurred at the Changhua onshore substation site of the Hai Long Offshore Wind Project, resulting in multiple injuries and the loss of life, shared in an update on the incident today.

Incident at Hai Long Offshore Wind Project claims life, injures several

General Windfarms

Norway’s state controlled energy company, Equinor, has announced the cancellation of its plans to invest in Vietnam’s offshore wind sector, marking a significant setback for the country’s green energy ambitions.

Equinor withdraws from Vietnam offshore wind market, closes Hanoi office

Cables General Grid Windfarms

Hitachi Energy is calling for immediate measures to expand global power grids, reduce connection bottlenecks, and support the energy transition with advanced power electronics.

Hitachi Energy urges swift action to address grid bottlenecks and accelerate energy transition

CHMI General Turbines Vessels Windfarms

CSBC-DEME Wind Engineering (CDWE) has successfully installed the first jacket foundation at the Hai Long Offshore Wind Farm, marking a significant achievement in the project.

CDWE achieves major milestone in Hai Long Offshore Wind Farm Project

General Windfarms

The Bureau of Ocean Energy Management (BOEM) has announced that it will hold its first Guam Intergovernmental Renewable Energy Task Force meeting on September 11, 2024.

BOEM to hold inaugural Guam renewable energy task force meeting

CHMI Corporate General Turbines Vessels Windfarms

Cadeler A/S has released its Interim Financial Report for the first half of 2024, reporting results that align with expectations and show-casing a record-breaking order backlog.

Cadeler reports steady growth and record order backlog in H1 2024

CHMI General Vessels

Østensjø Rederi has signed a contract with Spanish shipyard Astilleros Gondan for the construction of a new Ocean Energy Support Vessel (OESV).

Østensjø Rederi orders new ocean energy support vessel from spanish shipyard

Cables General Interconnectors Turbines Windfarms

The European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity (ENTSO-E) has issued a new guidance document to assist EU Member States in preparing Offshore Network Development Plans (ONDPs) for 2026.

ENTSO-E releases guidance for offshore network development plans

General Windfarms

The Planning Inspectorate has accepted North Falls Offshore Wind Farm's Development Consent Order (DCO) application for examination, marking a significant step forward for the project.

North Falls Offshore Wind Farm's DCO application accepted for examination

CHMI General Vessels Windfarms

Integrated Wind Solutions ASA (IWS) has announced the successful delivery of its third Commissioning Service Operation Vessel (CSOV), the IWS Seawalker.

IWS takes delivery of third cutting-edge offshore wind vessel

General Turbines Windfarms

Researchers at the U.S. Department of Energy’s National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) have made a significant breakthrough in the development of bio-derivable wind turbine blades that can be chemically recycled.

NREL advances method for recyclable wind turbine blades

General Windfarms

On August 22, 2024, the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) announced its decision to set an initial goal of 7.6 GW for procuring offshore wind energy, with projects expected to come online between 2031 and 2037. Offshore Wind California (OWC), a trade group representing offshore wind developers, praised the decision, calling it a significant step toward establishing the state as a global leader in floating offshore wind energy.

California Public Utilities Commission approves major offshore wind target

General Windfarms

Interconnect Malta has launched a comprehensive offshore survey within Malta’s Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) to explore the potential for renewable energy development.

Malta commences offshore survey for renewable energy development

General Turbines Windfarms

Vattenfall AB, along with its subsidiaries Vattenfall Vindkraft A/S and DanTysk Sandbank Offshore Wind GmbH & Co. KG, has announced a tender for helicopter services to support its offshore wind operations in Denmark and Germany.

Vattenfall seeks helicopter services for offshore wind farms in Denmark and Germany

General Turbines Windfarms

A blade failure occurred yesterday morning at the Dogger Bank A offshore wind farm, which is currently under construction.

Second blade failure in recent months hits offshore wind industry

Foundations General Turbines Windfarms

The 640 MW Yunlin Offshore Wind Farm (OWF) in Taiwan has reached a major milestone with the successful installation of all 80 foundations, comprising monopiles and transition pieces.

Yunlin Offshore Wind Farm completes foundation installation, enters final phase

Cables General Windfarms

SunCable has received environmental approval from the Australian government for its ambitious Australia-Asia Power Link (AAPowerLink) project.

SunCable's Australia-Asia power link project receives environmental approval

General Windfarms

The Ministry of Economic Affairs and Employment has released an action plan aimed at enhancing Finland's position in offshore wind power production, particularly in comparison with other Baltic Sea nations.

Finland unveils action plan to boost offshore wind power

General Windfarms

TenneT TSO B.V., the Netherlands' offshore grid operator, has awarded a €7 million contract for engineering support services related to the development of its offshore grid connections in the Netherlands, a crucial infrastructure for connecting offshore wind farms to the onshore power grid.

TenneT awards €7 million contract for offshore grid engineering support

General Windfarms

On August 20, Heerema Fabrication Group celebrated a significant milestone in the development of the Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm.

Heerema Fabrication Group commences steel cutting for Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm

General Windfarms

Polenergia and Equinor are on the verge of launching the construction of two major offshore wind farms in the Baltic Sea, following the issuance of critical construction permits by the Pomeranian Voivode.

Polenergia and Equinor near construction phase for Baltic offshore wind farms

CHMI General Vessels Windfarms

Fugro, a global business in Geo-data services, has secured a long-term contract to provide construction support for Van Oord's offshore wind farms across Europe.

Fugro secures multi-year contract for European offshore wind farms

General Windfarms

The U.S. offshore wind energy industry made substantial progress in 2023, marked by the delivery of the nation's first commercial-scale offshore wind power and increased investments in infrastructure.

U.S. offshore wind industry saw significant growth in 2023

Corporate General Windfarms

New York State is witnessing a surge in clean energy jobs, fuelled by significant investments in renewable energy and billions in federal funding from the Inflation Reduction Act.

Clean energy jobs surge in New York, driven by renewable investments

General Windfarms

The Bureau of Ocean Energy Management (BOEM) has begun the process for a second offshore wind energy sale in the Central Atlantic region.

BOEM initiates second Central Atlantic offshore wind project, seeks public input

In a significant milestone for China's offshore wind energy sector, the country’s first two domestically built Service Operation Vessels (SOVs) were officially named and delivered on August 16, 2024.

China's first offshore wind power SOVs delivered

Corporate General Windfarms

Dajin Heavy Industry Co., Ltd. announced a significant safety milestone at its Penglai Facility, achieving 500,000 man-hours without a Lost Time Injury (LTI) during the Thor TP-Less Monopile Project.

Dajin Heavy Industry reaches 500,000 man-hours without lost time injury during Thor project

Corporate General Turbines Windfarms

SENSEWind has reached a significant milestone in the development of its 2 MW self-installing wind turbine demonstrator.

SENSEWind achieves key milestone with successful factory testing

Corporate General Windfarms

Ramboll, an engineering and consultancy firm, has acquired K2 Management, a global consultancy specialising in wind and solar energy, to enhance its Wind division.

Ramboll acquires K2 Management to strengthen global wind energy capabilities

General Windfarms

IUCN (the International Union for Conservation of Nature) and Ecowende signed a partnership agreement with the aim to provide advice on the wind farm developer's extensive programme on nature preservation and reinforcement for the Hollandse Kust West wind farm in the North Sea.

Ecowende sign partnership for nature preservation and reinforcement for the Hollandse Kust West wind farm

SPIE Global Services Energy has been awarded two multi-year framework agreements. Vattenfall has chosen Correll to carry out cable testing and fault finding for its offshore wind farms in Europe.

General Interconnectors Windfarms

Eversource Energy is pleased to announce its Huntsbrook Offshore Wind (OSW) Hub project proposal was recently awarded $89 million in federal grant funding through the second round of the U.S.

Eversource Energy secures federal funding for U.S. Offshore Wind Hub

The Bureau of Ocean Energy Management (BOEM) has announced the execution of a floating offshore wind energy research lease.

BOEM issues offshore wind research lease to State of Maine

Tokyo-based Sumitomo Corporation has acquired an equity stake in the newly founded EEW Offshore Wind Holding.

Sumitomo acquires stake in EEW Offshore Wind

Moray West offshore wind farm has achieved a major milestone, with more than half of the total 60 Siemens Gamesa turbines now installed.

Cadeler has named the fifth and newest addition to its fleet, Wind Peak.

Taiwan's offshore wind industry development has reache another milestone its expanded Taichung Nacelle Plant is officially starting production.

Hai Long Offshore Wind project announces official launch of Nacelle production line

Caledonia has selected offshore wind engineering consultancy Wood Thilsted to develop the structural concept design for the project’s turbine foundations.

Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey, Lieutenant Governor Kim Driscoll and other leaders celebrated a significant milestone on 15 August with the ceremonial groundbreaking of the Salem Offshore Wind Terminal.

Massachusetts leaders join Crowley to celebrate groundbreaking of Salem Offshore Wind Terminal

Strong performance in offshore wind drove earnings at Ørsted up for the first six months of the year, despite impairments due to project delays and cancellations.

Ørsted’s strong performance in offshore wind drives earnings up

Corporate General Windfarms

Equinor and Dominion Energy have provisionally won two separate US offshore wind leases in the Central Atlantic tender after placing bids totalling almost $93m.

According to a new report, the UK and New Zealand have a unique opportunity to unlock the full potential of New Zealand's offshore wind industry.

Offshore wind opportunity for UK and New Zealand partnership

LS Marine Solution has announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) for offshore wind power complex construction support with Dong Fang Offshore (DFO), a Taiwanese service operation vessel (SOV) specialist.

Adjusted EBITDA in the Offshore Wind segment amounted to €828 million, compared to €762 million in the first half of 2023.

RWE increases earnings from renewables to a record high in first half of 2024

Global offshore wind developer Corio Generation and Brazilian shipyard and marine construction company Estaleiros do Brasil (EBR) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU)

Cables Corporate Floating General Windfarms

The potential to see new floating turbines generating enough renewable energy to power more than 4 million up to 4.5GW.

Crown sets a new chapter for the UK’s world-leading offshore wind industry

Eastern Green Link 2 (EGL2) is the first of 26 projects to complete a fast-track process to secure funding through Ofgem’s new Accelerated Strategic Transmission Investment (ASTI) framework.

UK £3.4 billion fast-track funding package for a proposed new subsea cable

Companies connected to RWE, TotalEnergies and Luxcara have won the latest German offshore wind auction for three centrally pre-investigated project zones.

The USVs will be mobilised from Scarborough or Hartlepool Harbour where each USV will be escorted out of the harbour limits, before transiting to the survey area. Although vessels are uncrewed, they are managed remotely continuously using 360 degree cameras and other sensors.

USVs to carry out survey within Dogger Bank D Array and export cable route areas

Floating General

Floating wind turbine developer SeaTwirl has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Serica Energy to collaborate around exploring the feasibility of electrification of offshore assets and oil and gas activities with SeaTwirl's floating wind turbine.

Swedish floating wind developer SeaTwirl signs MOU with Serica Energy

The newly updated schedule of repair works of the Estonian-Finland electricity connection EstLink 2 will be completed no later than 12 September, and the connection will be available to the market from the 13 September.

Vital EastLink 2 energy link repair expected by 12 September

Mingyang Smart Energy Group The world's largest single-capacity floating wind power platform set sail from the southern Chinese megalopolis of Guangzhou Sunday to an offshore wind farm in Yangjiang City, also in Guangdong Province.

Mingyang’s OceanX the largest single capacity floating wind platform launches

Cables General Windfarms

On August 8, the "Taurus," Asia's largest submarine cable laying robot, successfully completed a critical offshore wind power array cable installation in the western Guangdong waters.

RWE and Global Wind Service (GWS) have successfully completed the first phase of operations at the Amrumbank West Wind Farm, transitioning into the next phase of this pivotal offshore wind project.

Clyde Training Solutions (CTS), one of the UK's largest providers of Marine, Offshore, and Renewables safety training, has launched a new training centre in Greater Glasgow.

Clyde Training Solutions opens new safety training centre near Glasgow

CHC Helicopter, a global specialist in helicopter services, has been awarded a contract by RWE Renewables to provide crew transportation for the Sofia Offshore Wind Farm, located in the North Sea.

CHC Helicopter secures contract for Sofia Offshore Wind Farm crew transport

Corporate Floating General Windfarms

In a significant move to advance Italy's energy and climate goals, a partnership has been signed between the Ministry of Enterprises and Made in Italy (MIMIT), Renexia, and Mingyang Smart Energy.

Italy takes major step toward developing national supply chain for floating offshore wind

Corporate General Windfarms

Skyborn Renewables Taiwan Co., Ltd. has received significant recognition for its environmental efforts, earning two awards for its work on the Yunlin Offshore Wind Farm Project.

Yunlin Offshore Wind Farm wins dual sustainability awards

General Windfarms

A recent poll conducted by Opinium Research, commissioned by RenewableUK, reveals that a significant majority of the UK public are frustrated when renewable energy projects are blocked, especially when these projects have local support.

Poll reveals public frustration over blocked renewable energy projects

General Ports

The Port of Aberdeen has officially begun construction on Scotland’s largest commercial shore power system, a £4 million project aimed at providing clean electricity to vessels at seven berths.

Port of Aberdeen begins construction on Scotland’s largest shore power system

Corporate Floating General Windfarms

South Korea's Vice Minister of Trade, Industry and Energy, Namho Choe, announced the launch of the Offshore Wind Power Competitive Bidding Roadmap.

South Korea unveils offshore wind power Competitive Bidding Roadmap

Rovco has joined global industry group the Global wind Energy Council (GWEC). In joining GWEC, Rovco becomes part of a leading community of more than 1,500 companies across 80 countries, collaborating to create a better global policy environment for wind power.

Rovco joins Global Wind Energy Council

Corporate General Windfarms

The Offshore Renewable Energy (ORE) Catapult, the UK’s leading technology innovation and research centre for offshore renewables, has appointed Maida Zahirovic as a Non-Executive Director.

Maida Zahirovic appointed Non-Executive Director at ORE Catapult

General Windfarms

A consortium of Australian universities has launched the Australian Centre for Offshore Wind Energy (ACOWE), aimed at addressing the unique challenges of establishing an offshore wind energy industry in the country.

Universities launch collaborative effort to advance offshore wind energy in Australia

BlueFloat Energy has revealed the site location of its 'Winds of September Phase 1' project to participate in the upcoming floating Demonstration Program, due to be launched by the Taiwanese government later in 2024.

The National Infrastructure Planning authority has completed the examination of Rampion Extension Development Limited’s application for the Rampion 2 Offshore Wind Farm.

Rampion 2 offshore wind farm examination concludes

Research published by SOWEC explores how developers of offshore wind could go above and beyond existing mitigations to maximise opportunities for nature while developing green infrastructure projects.

New marine report by SOWEC for offshore wind projects in Scotland

Ørsted is deploying heavy-lift cargo drones for the first time in an operational campaign at the Borssele 1&2 Offshore Wind Farm.

General Ports Turbines Vessels Windfarms

Mammoet has entered into an agreement to become the exclusive contractor for the provision of heavy lift and transport services at Steel River Quay, which lies at the heart of the Teesworks industrial zone in Teesside.

Mammoet enters agreement to become exclusive contractor for heavy-lift and heavy transport service supplier at Steel River Quay

HSM Offshore Energy announces the successful load out and sail away of the N05-A topside and jacket for ONE-Dyas at its Schiedam yard in the Netherlands. The project will be powered by electricity generated from the nearby Riffgat offshore wind farm.

HSM Offshore Energy completes load out of topside and jacket, project powered by offshore wind

Forth Ports is to name its newly constructed deep water riverside berth at the Port of Leith.

On August 2, 2024, the Humboldt Bay Harbour, Recreation, and Conservation District released a Solicitation of Interest for the Humboldt Bay Offshore Wind Heavy Lift Marine Terminal Project.

Synera Renewable Energy announced its Formosa 6 Offshore Wind Project has been awarded 800 MW of development capacity by the Ministry of Economic Affairs.

Tokyo Gas announces that it has made investment in the 'WindFloat Atlantic' operational floating offshore wind farm in Portugal, operated by Windplus S.A., a majority owned subsidiary of Ocean Winds (OW).

Tokyo Gas & Ocean Winds join forces in the WindFloat Atlantic floating offshore wind farm

Hundreds of green energy jobs could be created under plans to upgrade harbours in Scarborough and Whitby, first reported by the BBC.

Harbour upgrade plan could create offshore jobs in Scarborough and Whitby

Vard announces that it has signed a contract for the design and construction of one Energy Construction Vessel (ECV) with Wind Energy Construction AS.

Wind Energy Construction AS contracts VARD for ECV

A pay dispute involving around 300 Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy wind turbine workers in Hull has been called off after Unite, the UK’s leading union, secured a deal worth 8.4 per cent.

Fugro has successfully completed four years of continuous survey operations in New Jersey and New York for US-based offshore wind developer Atlantic Shores Offshore Wind.

The Azerbaijan Renewable Energy Agency has announced that work on measuring the wind potential in the relevant area in the sea in Azerbaijan has been started.

Azerbaijan announces LiDAR project has begun to measure offshore wind potential

PGE Baltica, a PGE Group company, has signed a framework agreement with ‘PROJMORS’ Biuro Projektów Budownictwa Morskiego sp. z o.o. for technical consultancy in connection with the implementation of offshore wind energy investments in port areas.

PGE Baltica signs framework agreement for offshore wind energy investments in Polish port areas

Iberdrola has today signed an agreement to acquire 88% of Electricity North West (ENW) in the UK for an equity value of £2.1 billion (€2.5 billion).

17 Energy & SC Power unveiled the Viento Azul Biobío (VAB) Consortium, a partnership aimed at developing Chile's offshore wind industry.

Prysmian and Marinus Link Pty Ltd. have finalised an around €600 million contract for a new power interconnector between Victoria and Tasmania, Australia.

Kevin Kroll joins RWE Clean Energy as new Chief Operating Officer.

The Hanseatic and University City of Rostock, the largest city in the German state of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, and electricity transmission system operator 50Hertz entered a leasehold contract with a term of at least 60 years for a plot in the Warnemünde harbour.

50hertz signs leasehold contract with the Hanseatic and University of Rostock

Boskalis announces it has successfully completed the intricate task of installing and connecting all export cables for the Hollandse Kust (west Beta) Wind farm.

Iberdrola, ICO, Sabadell and HSBC have signed a syndicated green loan for an amount of 500 million euros. The funds from the operation will be used to finance renewable wind and photovoltaic projects, as well as battery projects in the United States, Australia and Italy.

Iberdrola and partners sign €500 million green loan

Governor Wes Moore has announced $4.7 million in federal funding to provide training and job placement to grow Maryland’s offshore wind workforce.

U.S. Governor Moore announces $4.7 million in federal funding to strengthen Maryland offshore wind workforce
